section.name: Joda Time - GWT port
section.p: Joda-Time provides a complete quality alternative to the JDK date and time classes. Google Web Toolkit (GWT) is a development toolkit for building and optimizing complex browser-based applications, which allows you to write client-side applications in Java and deploy them as JavaScript.

This sub-project was setup to be able to use Joda-Time in a GWT environment. To make this as easy as possible, at server side it makes no difference whether you use Joda-Time or Joda-Time-GWT. And for the client side, in the browser, Joda-Time-GWT maximizes the amount of code that you can still use in a transparent way. Inevitably there are some exceptions though. They are discussed in detail in the user guide.

section.name: Releases
section.p: Release 1.6.0.0 is the current latest release. Please bear in mind that this project is separate from Joda-Time itself.

Note that Joda-Time-GWT uses a 4 level release numbering scheme. The first 3 levels refer to the Joda-Time release that Joda-Time-GWT is built upon. The fourth level indicates the fix version that is specific to Joda-Time-GWT.

section.name: Support
section.p: The Joda-Time-GWT library was contributed to Joda-Time by Rintcius Blok. Support on bugs, library usage or enhancement requests is available via:

ul.li: the joda-interest mailing list. Due to spam, you must be subscribed to post to the mailing list.
